raw_text: A reordering model in the framework of weighted finite state transducers is described in (Kumar and Byrne, 2005)
clean_text: A reordering model in the framework of weighted finite state transducers is described in (Kumar and Byrne, 2005).

raw_text: A reordering model with reordering constraints, such as ITG constraints (Wu, 1997), IBM constraints (Berger et al1996), and local constraints (Kumar and Byrne, 2005) can account for the syn tactic differences
clean_text: A reordering model with reordering constraints, such as ITG constraints (Wu, 1997), IBM constraints (Berger et al1996), and local constraints (Kumar and Byrne, 2005) can account for the syntactic differences.

raw_text: Its complexity is O (dI (Id+1)), which is roughly exponential in d. There are additional variants, such as the Maxi mum Jump d strategy (MJd), a polynomial-time strategy described by Kumar and Byrne (2005), and possibly others
clean_text: There are additional variants, such as the Maximum Jump d strategy (MJd), a polynomial-time strategy described by Kumar and Byrne (2005), and possibly others.

citing_paper_authors: Markus, Dreyer | Keith, Hall | Sanjeev P., Khudanpur
raw_text: Some models (Brown et al (1996), Kumar and Byrne (2005)) allow words to change place with their local neighbors, but disallow global reorderings

citing_paper_authors: Markus, Dreyer | Keith, Hall | Sanjeev P., Khudanpur
raw_text: Kumar and Byrne (2005) define two local reordering models for their Translation Tem plate Model (TTM): In the first one, called MJ-1, only adjacent phrases are allowed to swap, and the movement has to be done within a window of 2
clean_text: Kumar and Byrne (2005) define two local reordering models for their Translation Template Model (TTM): In the first one, called MJ-1, only adjacent phrases are allowed to swap, and the movement has to be done within a window of 2.

citing_paper_authors: Alexander M., Rush | Michael John, Collins
raw_text: (2009) show that exact FST decoding is feasible for a phrase-based system with limited reordering (the MJ1 model (Kumar and Byrne, 2005)), and de Gispert et al (2010) show that exact FSTdecodingis feasible for a specific class of hierarchical gram mars (shallow-1 grammars)
clean_text: Iglesias et al. (2009) show that exact FST decoding is feasible for a phrase-based system with limited reordering (the MJ1 model (Kumar and Byrne, 2005)), and de Gispert et al (2010) show that exact FST decoding is feasible for a specific class of hierarchical grammars (shallow-1 grammars).

raw_text: One might try to address this issue by limiting a priori the amount of re-ordering, in the spirit of (Kumar and Byrne, 2005), which would allow to approximate a phrase-based model by a standard transducer, but this would introduce further issues
clean_text: One might try to address this issue by limiting a priori the amount of re-ordering, in the spirit of (Kumar and Byrne, 2005), which would allow to approximate a phrase-based model by a standard transducer, but this would introduce further issues.

citing_paper_authors: Gonzalo, Iglesias | Adrià de, Gispert | Eduardo R., Banga | William, Byrne
raw_text: The system implements either a monotone phrase order translation, or an MJ1 (maximum phrase jump of 1) reordering model (Kumar and Byrne, 2005)
clean_text: The system implements either a monotone phrase order translation, or an MJ1 (maximum phrase jump of 1) reordering model (Kumar and Byrne, 2005).
